conclusion: To determine the amount of heat exchanged, analyze each step of the cycle using thermodynamics.
Cycle consists of four processes: AB (Isothermal expansion), BC (Isobaric expansion), CD (Isothermal compression), DA (Isobaric compression).
Net work done by the gas is the area enclosed by the cycle: W_net = (P2 - P1)(V2 - V1).
For AB (Isothermal Expansion), internal energy change is zero, heat absorbed Q_AB = W_AB = nRT_0 ln(V2/V1).
For BC (Isobaric Expansion), work done W_BC = P2 (V2 - V1), change in internal energy ΔU_BC = nC_V ΔT.
Using ideal gas law, ΔT can be expressed in terms of pressure and volume changes.
For CD (Isothermal Compression), internal energy change is zero, heat released Q_CD = W_CD = -nRT_0 ln(V2/V1).
For DA (Isobaric Compression), work done W_DA = P1 (V2 - V1), change in internal energy is negative of ΔU_BC.
Net heat exchanged Q_net = Q_AB + Q_BC + Q_CD + Q_DA.
Since the cycle is closed, net change in internal energy is zero (ΔU_net = 0).
Net heat exchanged is equal to net work done: Q_net = W_net = (P2 - P1)(V2 - V1).
Final answer: The amount of heat exchanged is (P2 - P1)(V2 - V1).
